td.content: Arteriogram of the upper and lower extremities
shows multiple small and medium-sized arterial occlusions with formation of compensatory corkscrew collaterals
shows mild to moderate aortic valve stenosis but revealed no cardiac source of emboli

revealed widely patent vessels until the level of the lower calf where blood flow disappeared in both legs, segmental narrowing was noted in the left superficial femoral and popliteal arteries with little collateralization

td.content: s:patient presents with chronic Blood. pt is a f aged 78 Ys. she has a history of smoking she drinks alcohol occasionally o:Height 64 in, Weight 140 lbs, Temperature 97.8 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 15, Arteriogram of the upper and lower extremities shows multiple small and medium-sized arterial occlusions with formation of compensatory corkscrew collaterals a:Buergers Disease p:administered Naproxen - 250 mg po q 12h prn, Chantix - 1 mg po bid x 11 weeks, pentoxifylline - 400 mg po tid, performed Arteriogram of the upper and lower extremities, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
